Learjets are not pre-approved to go to Turkey. They can go but Flight Planning must request the permits with FlyService Turkey. Please ask them for the aircraft documentation that is required. No info about PPRs for the learjet. Please check with the handler or FlyService Turkey. FlyService Turkey email: occ@flyserviceturkey.net FlyService Turkey Phone Number: +90 538 927 08 05 All the positioning flights overflying and/or operating in and out of Turkey require Turkish Permits. Please request them with FlyService Turkey Airport slots details: Slots coordination numbers Tel: +90 212 891 74 74 Fax: +90 212 891 74 75; Handler Contact Details 0090 212 5411090 handling 0090 546 2742122 (24h)

BUD is not slot coordinated for general aviation flights. Still send gcr to the 2 email addresses included below. Most likely will not get an answer but it is good to inform them. Slot Coordination Phone Number: 00361 293 4050. For the airport duty manager (in case of issues during the night) the phone number is:00361 296 400. BUD has a limited number of night movements between 2200-0300 UTC. Call the airport duty manager (number is above) to confirm if there is any issue for the new flight.

Paris Beauvais Tillé airport is coordinated from November 5, 2024 to February 11, 2025 General and business aviation: Aircraft operators contact their handling agent who is in charge to request airport slots to COHOR.

We need to get in contact with CFU ops in order to obtain a PPR number. The format for the email looks like & the address is cfuops@skyserv.aero: gcr /REG LGKR NMABEU MABEU 15JUL 008L45 LIME1315 1340EGSS DD SI PLEASE PROVIDE PPR ID NUMBERS SI AIRCRAFT REG MABEU You may need to ring CFU ops to try speed them up but ideally, they’ll reply with the following (I have highlighted in bold the times that we’ve requested): Dear Colleagues, Please find below PPR approval : PPR LGKR07629150724/1507241315/1507241340 has been approved! Concerned Airport: LGKR Flight details Aircraft Registration: MABEU Operator: FR Flight Number Arrival: 0001D Service Type Arrival: P Flight Number Departure: 0001E Service Type Departure: P Scheduled Date/Time of Arrival: 15JUL1315 Scheduled Date/Time of Departure: 15JUL1340 Minimum Ground Time: Now that they’ve sent on PPRs, we still need to obtain the runway slots off the slot coordinator for Greece, which is slot@hsca.gr . Copy the PPRs from point 2 below the request as follows: gcr /REG LGKR NRYR001D RYR001E 15JUL 008L45 LIME1315 1340EGSS DD PPR LGKR07629150724/1507241315/1507241340 GI NEW SLOT REQ A/C REG MABEU Please note, they wanted the ICAO operator code which is RYR not FR. Finally, the coordinator will hopefully reply with the following, confirming all is good: gcr /FLT LGKR KRYR001D RYR001E 15JUL 008LJ45 LIME1315 1340EGSS DD / IDA.LGKRARYR0001D0 IDD.LGKRDRYR0001E0 RE.MABEU/ SI LGKR07629150724/1507241315/1507241340 GI KIND REGARDS GEORGIA The line above that I have put in bold is the slot ID that I forward to the flight planners.

For all tech recovery flights in AMS/EIN (tech stop / transporting spare parts / engineers etc.) please use service type X. This applies to all A/C types. Slot coordination general number: 0031 20 4059730; Slot coordination number EIN Coordinator: 0031686806597 ; Viggo handler numbers: T: +31 40 258 11 58; M: +31 6 27 07 36 58. ; EIN OPS: +31 (0)40 291 9823 Handler website:https://www.viggo.eu/en/ ; NL Slot coordination website: https://slotcoordination.nl/contact/ Learjet slot granting steps: • SCR message to handler scr@slotcoordination.nl with service type X. • In case it’s not accepted (tell you they don’t have PPRs) ask handler for exception. You may be instructed to contact airport authorities. (Disclaimer: usually we really need the slots due to AOGs there) • Ask handler to speak with airport if possible or to provide you or confirm which number you need to call airport authorities at. (previously provided EIN OPS number: +31402919823) • If an exception is made proceed with PPRs if they are given. If they say that it will be handled as a normal flight. please apply with normal SCR and STC (service type) P. • Please apply as per normal procedure with CHG request - SCR and STC (service type) P. • In case you need to reach slot coordination but hey are not answering you can kindly ask for help EIN OPS +31402919823 . IMPORTANT ------------- ANY DIVERSIONS TO EIN/AMS, REMEMEBER TO CANCEL THE ARRIVAL SLOT AT EIN. BUT IF THERE IS A DIVERSION BUT STILL GOING TO EIN PLEASE DO A CHANGE REQUEST WITH NEW infoRMATION ANY CANCELLATIONS, PLEASE CANCEL THE SLOTS. NO NEED TO CREATE FICTIONAL SLOTS

Book through OCS positioning (P), scheduled(J) and general aviation flights (D). General Aviation flights do not need slots, nor PPRs, but still book through OCS or send SCR to them.

For General Aviation flights (D) PPRs/ Slots are handled by Swissport Executive and not by the Slot Coordination Authority. PPR numbers are usually attached to the handling file. Their contact details are +41 22 306 12 60 / For commercial (J) and Positioning flights (P) send SCR, preferably in turnaround format to the emails below. Contact details for the slot coordination authority are +41 43 816 7766 (Monday - Friday 08:00 - 17:00 CET). For more info, their website is https://www.slotcoordination.ch/

We need PPRs even though the airport is not coordinated. But only for arrivals. 1. Send SLOT REQ as soon as an ad-hoc flight is added via this website PPR | Lithuanian Airports (ltou.lt). 2. You need to submit a few documents but you can ask for a hand Crew control for General declaration (GEN dec) and OPS for Air Operator Certificate No. (sent to all via email). 3. When filling do not put your personal name but Ryanair. 4. Ground Handling we use Litcargus checked with GOPS. NB! No PPRs for test flights (T). Aviation Authorities phone number: 0037061012665 Gendec template: https://www.aeroplusaviation.com/wp-content/uploads/General_Declaration_form.doc Website for PPR: https://www.ltou.lt/en/forms/ppr-kun-eyka Description of the procedure and NOTAM: https://www.ltou.lt//uploads/documents/files/SAFETY/PPR/LTOU%20PPR%20ED%20No_1_1%20EN_rev%20(1).pdf KUN-KUN [TRAINING FLIGHT] NO PPRS REQUIRED
